item.description:
When: Sunday, October 7. Meet at 11:30 in New Haven to carpool otherwise meet at the Orchards at 12:30

Carpool meetup spot: The Yale parking lot next to 302 Temple Street, across from the New Haven Public Library. It's on your right after Wall St. I will meet you at the orchard as I will not be carpooling.

What: A corn maze in the shape of a windy, twisty spider web.

Where: Lyman Orchards in Middlefield, CT (about 40 minutes from New Haven)

Why: Because it's a fall activity every good New Englander does. If you have never experienced one before, now is your time to try!

Cost: $9 (or $8 if you print off the $1 off coupon on their website).


Description:
Lyman Orchards is located in Middletown, CT, approximately 40 minutes from New Haven. This Corn Maze covers 4 acres of land and is craftily carved into a spooky spider web.

Poor sense of direction? No need to worry. Lyman Orchards provides maps, educational materials, 'interactive passports', and trivia questions to help you through. If you really suck at reading a map and don't know a lick of trivia, you can always talk to a 'corn cop' to help you get out.

If the corn maze doesn't interest you whatsoever but can't stand to be separated from the group for a day, Lyman Orchards offers apple picking, pumpkin picking, farm stands, frisbee golf and more to keep you busy while the rest of us get lost.

Admission is $9 without the coupon or $8 with the coupon. Lyman Orchards has a heart! One dollar from every admission is donated to the American Cancer Society. Over the past 6 years, they have donated over $128,000 to the fund.

Click here for COUPON


C'mon out for a great day of relaxing, New England fun!

Contact: Amanda O. - (203) 823-5332

Can we get more 'Mazers' than last year?
item.name: 2nd Annual Corn Maze
